  "title": "Supply Chain Manager",
  "description": "Deloxe is a forward-thinking human resources consulting firm dedicated to optimizing workforce potential and driving organizational success. We deliver innovative HR solutions that empower businesses, enhance employee experiences, and foster sustainable growth. At Deloxe, we are committed to transforming workplaces through strategic HR management and cutting-edge solutions that maximize efficiency and impact.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supply Chain Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Department: Operations / Supply Chain
Reports To: Head of Supply Chain &amp; Operations
Industry: Wellness / Health / FMCG

Job Summary


	We are seeking an experienced and strategic Supply Chain Manager to oversee and optimize the end-to-end supply chain operations of our wellness company.
	The role will ensure the efficient sourcing, production planning, inventory management, and distribution of wellness products while maintaining quality, regulatory compliance, and cost efficiency.
	The ideal candidate will support business growth by building a resilient and sustainable supply chain.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, manage, and optimize end-to-end supply chain operations (procurement, production planning, warehousing, and distribution)
	Develop demand forecasting and supply planning strategies aligned with sales and marketing plans
	Manage supplier sourcing, evaluation, and contract negotiations
	Ensure timely availability of raw materials and finished goods
	Oversee inventory levels to minimize stock-outs, expiries, and excess inventory
	Coordinate logistics and distribution to ensure on-time delivery to distributors, retail outlets, and e-commerce customers
	Monitor and manage supply chain costs and budgets
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and regulatory standards applicable to wellness products
	Implement supply chain KPIs and performance dashboards
	Lead, coach, and develop supply chain and warehouse teams
	Identify and mitigate supply chain risks and disruptions
	Drive continuous improvement initiatives across the supply chain.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Inventory turnover and stock availability
	Order fulfillment and delivery timelines
	Cost savings and budget adherence
	Supplier performance and compliance
	Reduction in wastage and expiries.


Required Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or related field
	3+ years of experience in supply chain or operations management (preferably in wellness, FMCG, pharmaceutical, or health-related industries)
	Proven experience in procurement, inventory management, and logistics coordination
	Strong knowledge of demand planning, forecasting, and ERP systems
	Experience managing vendors, 3PLs, and distribution partners.


Key Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
	Excellent negotiation and vendor management skills
	Proficiency in supply chain software and ERP systems
	Strong leadership and team management abilities
	Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
	High attention to detail and organizational skills.


Preferred / Added Advantage:


	Experience in regulated industries (wellness, pharmaceuticals, nutraceuticals, cosmetics, or FMCG)
	Knowledge of local and international sourcing regulations
	Exposure to sustainability and ethical sourcing practices
	Experience with e-commerce or omnichannel distribution.

Supply Chain Manager Job at Deloxe




        
    

        
        Deloxe is a forward-thinking human resources consulting firm dedicated to optimizing workforce potential and driving organizational success. We deliver innovative HR solutions that empower businesses, enhance employee experiences, and foster sustainable growth. At Deloxe, we are committed to transforming workplaces through strategic HR management and cutting-edge solutions that maximize efficiency and impact.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supply Chain Manager
Job Location: Lagos
Department: Operations / Supply Chain
Reports To: Head of Supply Chain & Operations
Industry: Wellness / Health / FMCG

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking an experienced and strategic Supply Chain Manager to oversee and optimize the end-to-end supply chain operations of our wellness company.
	The role will ensure the efficient sourcing, production planning, inventory management, and distribution of wellness products while maintaining quality, regulatory compliance, and cost efficiency.
	The ideal candidate will support business growth by building a resilient and sustainable supply chain.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, manage, and optimize end-to-end supply chain operations (procurement, production planning, warehousing, and distribution)
	Develop demand forecasting and supply planning strategies aligned with sales and marketing plans
	Manage supplier sourcing, evaluation, and contract negotiations
	Ensure timely availability of raw materials and finished goods
	Oversee inventory levels to minimize stock-outs, expiries, and excess inventory
	Coordinate logistics and distribution to ensure on-time delivery to distributors, retail outlets, and e-commerce customers
	Monitor and manage supply chain costs and budgets
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and regulatory standards applicable to wellness products
	Implement supply chain KPIs and performance dashboards
	Lead, coach, and develop supply chain and warehouse teams
	Identify and mitigate supply chain risks and disruptions
	Drive continuous improvement initiatives across the supply chain.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Inventory turnover and stock availability
	Order fulfillment and delivery timelines
	Cost savings and budget adherence
	Supplier performance and compliance
	Reduction in wastage and expiries.


Required Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or related field
	3+ years of experience in supply chain or operations management (preferably in wellness, FMCG, pharmaceutical, or health-related industries)
	Proven experience in procurement, inventory management, and logistics coordination
	Strong knowledge of demand planning, forecasting, and ERP systems
	Experience managing vendors, 3PLs, and distribution partners.


Key Skills & Competencies:


	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
	Excellent negotiation and vendor management skills
	Proficiency in supply chain software and ERP systems
	Strong leadership and team management abilities
	Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
	High attention to detail and organizational skills.


Preferred / Added Advantage:


	Experience in regulated industries (wellness, pharmaceuticals, nutraceuticals, cosmetics, or FMCG)
	Knowledge of local and international sourcing regulations
	Exposure to sustainability and ethical sourcing practices
	Experience with e-commerce or omnichannel distribution.

  "title": "UX Designer - Infrastructure",
  "description": "Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004.? Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: UX Designer - Infrastructure

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos (Remote)

About the Role


	We are hiring a UX Designer for Infrastructure to work with the exceptional engineering teams at Canonical, creating open-source tools that are used to build clouds and manage clusters of compute globally.&nbsp;
	Our design team is on a mission to turn complex, open-source software into efficient, intuitive products that can change how complex systems are built and what open source is capable of for enterprise IT.
	We are looking for a talented and technically oriented user experience designer, who shares our ambitions.&nbsp;
	This role sits in the design team reporting to the Infrastructure design manager.&nbsp;This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.


Responsibilities
The role entails:


	Building tools that enable everyone to build their own cloud experiences (MAAS, LXD, MicroCloud and Canonical k8s)
	Collaborating with product managers and engineers to shape the future of the Data Center: Self-sovereign Clouds
	Supporting deeply complex products with the process of design and UX heuristics&nbsp;
	Working to evolve and evangelise design systems that drive consistency and efficiency
	Understanding the broader scope of your work and its numerous interconnected constraints
	Supporting one of our working groups to enable Canonical design&rsquo;s horizontal efforts


Requirements
What we are looking for in you:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s or equivalent in User Experience, Design, or STEM or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
	Excitement about building things and working with real hardware
	Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
	Knowledge and passion for user experience, technology and design
	Commitment to continuous learning and improvement - curious, flexible, scientific
	Result-oriented with a drive to finish work and celebrate success
	Confidence in user research practices
	Engagement with the latest design research and innovation
	Ability to travel internationally twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long
	UX designers should be excellent communicators who are at ease working with a complex mix of engineers, designers and executives.
	They represent us at cross-functional company meetings and must present their design position with clarity and precision.
	They should be confident and excited to take on complex design challenges. They should also be able to connect their design leadership to the strategic vision of the company.


What we offer colleagues


	We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance.
	In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
	Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
	Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
	Annual compensation review
	Recognition rewards
	Annual holiday leave
	Maternity and paternity leave
	Team Member Assistance Program &amp; Wellness Platform
	Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
	Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events

UX Designer - Infrastructure Job at Canonical Nigeria




        
    

        
        Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004.? Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: UX Designer - Infrastructure
     

            
    



Job Location: Lagos (Remote)

About the Role


	We are hiring a UX Designer for Infrastructure to work with the exceptional engineering teams at Canonical, creating open-source tools that are used to build clouds and manage clusters of compute globally. 
	Our design team is on a mission to turn complex, open-source software into efficient, intuitive products that can change how complex systems are built and what open source is capable of for enterprise IT.
	We are looking for a talented and technically oriented user experience designer, who shares our ambitions. 
	This role sits in the design team reporting to the Infrastructure design manager. This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.


Responsibilities
The role entails:


	Building tools that enable everyone to build their own cloud experiences (MAAS, LXD, MicroCloud and Canonical k8s)
	Collaborating with product managers and engineers to shape the future of the Data Center: Self-sovereign Clouds
	Supporting deeply complex products with the process of design and UX heuristics 
	Working to evolve and evangelise design systems that drive consistency and efficiency
	Understanding the broader scope of your work and its numerous interconnected constraints
	Supporting one of our working groups to enable Canonical design’s horizontal efforts


Requirements
What we are looking for in you:


	Bachelor’s or equivalent in User Experience, Design, or STEM or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
	Excitement about building things and working with real hardware
	Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
	Knowledge and passion for user experience, technology and design
	Commitment to continuous learning and improvement - curious, flexible, scientific
	Result-oriented with a drive to finish work and celebrate success
	Confidence in user research practices
	Engagement with the latest design research and innovation
	Ability to travel internationally twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long
	UX designers should be excellent communicators who are at ease working with a complex mix of engineers, designers and executives.
	They represent us at cross-functional company meetings and must present their design position with clarity and precision.
	They should be confident and excited to take on complex design challenges. They should also be able to connect their design leadership to the strategic vision of the company.


What we offer colleagues


	We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance.
	In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
	Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
	Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
	Annual compensation review
	Recognition rewards
	Annual holiday leave
	Maternity and paternity leave
	Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
	Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
	Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events
